title: China's Didi reports third-quarter rebound from regulatory crackdown
content: China's largest ride-hailing company Didi Global reported third-quarter net income of 929 million yuan ($128.42 million) on Friday, as it built back its business after a regulatory crackdown.

title: Mercedes to use Momenta software in 4 models, accelerate China comeback, sources say
content: Mercedes-Benz is planning a $75-million investment in autonomous driving startup Momenta to enhance its market share in China. This partnership aims to incorporate Momenta's software into at least four future Mercedes models to be launched in China between 2025 and 2027, with potential expansion to other regions.

title: Hinduja Tech acquires TECOSIM group to enhance global mobility engineering services
content: Hinduja Tech Limited has acquired TECOSIM Group, a European engineering services provider, to expand its presence in Europe and strengthen its global market position. This move brings together TECOSIM's expertise in virtual validation and body engineering with Hinduja Tech's capabilities, aiming to deliver innovative mobility solutions and drive future automotive engineering advancements.

title: Alternative fuels key to making India self-reliant: Nitin Gadkari
content: Minister Nitin Gadkari emphasizes the importance of switching to biofuels and electric vehicles for sustainable development. India's transport sector heavily contributes to air pollution, and significant fossil fuels are imported annually. Initiatives like bio-CNG projects and municipal waste-to-bio-CNG projects are promoting a green economy, creating jobs, boosting exports, and making India self-reliant.

title: Why OTA updates feature is becoming essential for modern vehicles
content: The OTA system leverages secure connectivity—be it Wi-Fi, LTE, or 5G—to push updates from a centralised cloud server to individual vehicles. These updates are typically downloaded and stored until the vehicle is idle, at which point they are installed, ensuring minimal disruption and robust security. Currently, OTA updates mainly address infotainment systems, navigation, telematics, diagnostics, performance tuning, and driver assistance systems (ADAS), paving the way for a seamless and efficient user experience.

title: What industry wants for H2ICE adoption; govt seeks stronger representation for tech roadmap
content: Hydrogen technology is pegged to be a potential game changer in India's journey to achieve carbon neutrality by 2070. However, there are hurdles for Hydrogen adoption. Key among them are cost, and a favourable ecosystem. The Government official also says that "mission-mode efforts" are required from the automotive industry. He advocated for a need to break the silos, and also said that there aren't enough pressure groups from the industry. Stakeholders are encouraged to make more representations, backed by facts and figures, for new technology support.

title: China's Hesai to halve lidar prices next year, sees wide adoption in electric cars
content: "We are moving to a stage where millions of cars sold annually are equipped with lidar," Chief Executive David Li told Reuters in an interview. Halving the price would make the use of lidar appealing even for cheaper EVs priced below 150,000 yuan (USD 20,000), he added.

title: Lumax Auto Technologies acquires 60% stake in Greenfuel Energy Solutions for alternate fuel business
content: Lumax Auto Technologies expands into green fuels with Greenfuel acquisition. The deal, worth INR 153.09 crores, gives Lumax a majority stake in Greenfuel's CNG and hydrogen fuel systems business. This move positions Lumax for growth in the expanding alternative fuels market. Greenfuel supplies major automakers like Maruti Suzuki and Tata Motors.

title: ZF India launches advanced electronic stability control test track to enhance vehicle safety
content: ZF Commercial Vehicle Solutions India opened a new ESC test track in Chennai.  The track tests vehicle stability and handling.  It can test vehicles from two-wheelers to heavy trucks.  The track simulates real-world conditions.  ZF says the track will improve vehicle safety.  The track is open to customers and third parties.

title: Lilium's fall throws spotlight on air-taxi cash crunch

title: Amara Raja Infra sets up India's first green hydrogen fuelling station in Leh
content: India's first green hydrogen fueling station is ready in Leh.  Amara Raja Infra built the station for NTPC.  The station can produce 80kg of green hydrogen daily.  Five hydrogen fuel cell buses will now operate in Leh.  The station will help expand green hydrogen projects across India. This supports the National Hydrogen Energy Mission.

title: How software-defined vehicles are revolutionising commercial vehicles —and why you should care
content: For fleet operators, SDVs offer much more than the buzz of innovation. Think of reduced operational costs, improved efficiency, and even new revenue streams. However, making this a reality requires a practical, ROI-driven approach, especially in cost-sensitive regions like India. Over the next decade, SDVs are expected to transition from emerging technologies to standard practices, equipping the commercial vehicle industry with crucial digital connectivity and data-driven capabilities.
